channel.title: Articles on DDOG
channel.description: Recent content in Articles on DDOG

item.title: The next DDOG will be April 7th, 2021!
item.description: Follow us on Twitter to be the first to hear about the speakers! üê∂

item.title: 4th DDOG on February 16th
item.description: Our fourth edition of The Dutch DevOps & GitHub Community will take place on February 16th! What is DDOG We want to create a community for content related to DevOps and GitHub. We believe GitHub has a lot to offer and deserves a user group in the Netherlands. But we also love the different elements that enable DevOps. So we decided to combine those two into the community you are looking at.

item.title: DDOG 1: Speakers and schedule
item.description: With the first edition of DDOG just one week away, we are proud to announce our these great speakers! Deep-dive into Codespaces on GitHub Martin Woodward In this session, Martin Woodward from GitHub will join us live to give an interactive demo on the brand new Codespaces feature that allows you to stand up cloud-hosted development environments in minutes straight from your GitHub account. Learn how they work and how to create your own perfect environment.

item.title: Eventbrite event available
item.description: You can now register for our very first virtual meeting through EventBrite! This isn’t mandatory to be part of the event, but you will receive the link to access the meeting through email. We have some exiting speakers lined up which we will reveal in the coming weeks! Follow this site or our Twitter to be the first to know. Event Brite ÔªøÔªøÔªø

item.title: August 13th: Introducing DDOG
item.description: We are very excited to announce the first edition of The Dutch DevOps & GitHub Community. The launch of DDOG is scheduled for Thursday 13 August We want to create a community for content related to DevOps and GitHub. We believe GitHub has a lot to offer and deserves a user group in the Netherlands. But we also love the different elements that enable DevOps. So we decided to combine those two into the community you are looking at.
